item.title: Beneath the hill, a lost world: 4,000-year-old settlement found in Karnataka's Maski
item.description:
<![CDATA[Ancient artefacts believed to be around 4,000 years old have been discovered during an excavation near Mallikarjuna Hill and the Anjaneya Swamy Temple in Maski town, Raichur district. The region, already known for the discovery of a famous Ashokan inscription, has once again found itself in the archaeological spotlight.
A team of archaeologists currently researching in Maski has traced human activity in the area back 4,000 years, uncovering signs of an early and thriving civilisation.
More tha...]]>
